Regions and Endpoints

Overview

To reduce data latency in your applications, most Amazon Web Services products allow you to select a regional endpoint to make your requests. An endpoint is a URL that is the entry point for a web service. For example, https://dynamodb.us-west-2.amazonaws.com is an entry point for the Amazon DynamoDB service.

Some services, such as IAM, do not support regions; their endpoints therefore do not include a region. A few services, such as Amazon EC2, let you specify an endpoint that does not include a specific region, for example, https://ec2.amazonaws.com. In that case, AWS routes the endpoint to us-east-1.

If a service supports regions, the resources in each region are independent. For example, if you create an Amazon EC2 instance or an Amazon SQS queue in one region, the instance or queue is independent from instances or queues in another region.

For information about which regions are supported, see the specific region information for your product. For information about the AWS products and endpoints available in the AWS GovCloud (US) Region, go to AWS GovCloud (US) Endpoints in the AWS GovCloud (US) User Guide. For your convenience, the following tables provide information about the region, endpoint, and protocol(s) for each AWS product.

Amazon CloudFront

Amazon CloudFront distributions have a single endpoint: cloudfront.amazonaws.com.

Amazon CloudSearch

Region Name Region Endpoint Protocol
US East (Northern Virginia) Region us-east-1 cloudsearch.us-east-1.amazonaws.com HTTPS
US West (Northern California) Region us-west-1 cloudsearch.us-west-1.amazonaws.com HTTPS
US West (Oregon) Region us-west-2 cloudsearch.us-west-2.amazonaws.com HTTPS
EU (Ireland) Region eu-west-1 cloudsearch.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com HTTPS
Asia Pacific (Singapore) Region ap-southeast-1 cloudsearch.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com HTTPS

AWS CloudTrail supports the following endpoints:

Region Name Region Endpoint Protocol
US East (Northern Virginia) Region us-east-1 cloudtrail.us-east-1.amazonaws.com HTTPS
US West (Oregon) Region us-west-2 cloudtrail.us-west-2.amazonaws.com HTTPS

US West (Northern California) Region us-west-1 monitoring.us-west-1.amazonaws.com HTTP and HTTPS

Amazon Elastic MapReduce

Amazon Elastic MapReduce supports the following endpoints:

Region Name Region Endpoint Protocol
US East (Northern Virginia) Region us-east-1 elasticmapreduce.us-east-1.amazonaws.com HTTP and HTTPS
US West (Oregon) Region us-west-2 elasticmapreduce.us-west-2.amazonaws.com HTTP and HTTPS
US West (Northern California) Region us-west-1 elasticmapreduce.us-west-1.amazonaws.com HTTP and HTTPS
EU (Ireland) Region eu-west-1 elasticmapreduce.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com HTTP and HTTPS
Asia Pacific (Singapore) Region ap-southeast-1 elasticmapreduce.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com HTTP and HTTPS
Asia Pacific (Sydney) Region ap-southeast-2 elasticmapreduce.ap-southeast-2.amazonaws.com HTTP and HTTPS
Asia Pacific (Tokyo) Region ap-northeast-1 elasticmapreduce.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com HTTP and HTTPS
South America (Sao Paulo) Region sa-east-1 elasticmapreduce.sa-east-1.amazonaws.com HTTP and HTTPS

If you specify the general endpoint (elasticmapreduce.amazonaws.com), Amazon Elastic MapReduce directs your request to an endpoint in the default region. For accounts created on or after March 8, 2013, the default region is us-west-2; for older accounts, the default region is us-east-1.

For information about using Amazon Elastic MapReduce in AWS GovCloud (US), go to AWS GovCloud (US) Endpoints.

Amazon Flexible Payments Service (FPS and ASP)

Amazon Flexible Payments Service has four endpoints for requests, as listed in the following table. Two are for sandbox testing of Co-Branded User Interface (CBUI) and API requests, and two are for production CBUI and API requests.

Region Endpoint Protocol

Sandbox endpoint for Co-Branded service requests.

authorize.payments-sandbox.amazon.com/cobranded-ui/actions/start

 HTTPS

Production endpoint for Co-Branded service requests.

authorize.payments.amazon.com/cobranded-ui/actions/start

 HTTPS

Sandbox endpoint for Amazon FPS actions.

fps.sandbox.amazonaws.com

 HTTPS

Production endpoint for Amazon FPS actions.

fps.amazonaws.com

 HTTPS

 HTTPS

Amazon Route 53

Amazon Route 53 has a single endpoint: route53.amazonaws.com. It only supports HTTPS requests.

Amazon Simple Storage Service (S3)

Region name Region Endpoint Location constraint Protocol
US Standard * us-east-1

You can use one of the following two endpoints:

  • s3.amazonaws.com (Northern Virginia or Pacific Northwest)

  • s3-external-1.amazonaws.com (Northern Virginia only)

 (none required) HTTP and HTTPS
US West (Oregon) Region us-west-2 s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com us-west-2 HTTP and HTTPS
US West (Northern California) Region us-west-1 s3-us-west-1.amazonaws.com us-west-1 HTTP and HTTPS
EU (Ireland) Region eu-west-1 s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com

EU or eu-west-1

HTTP and HTTPS
Asia Pacific (Singapore) Region ap-southeast-1 s3-ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com ap-southeast-1 HTTP and HTTPS
Asia Pacific (Sydney) Region ap-southeast-2 s3-ap-southeast-2.amazonaws.com ap-southeast-2 HTTP and HTTPS
Asia Pacific (Tokyo) Region ap-northeast-1 s3-ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com ap-northeast-1 HTTP and HTTPS
South America (Sao Paulo) Region sa-east-1 s3-sa-east-1.amazonaws.com sa-east-1 HTTP and HTTPS

* For the US Standard Region, the endpoints work as follows:

  • s3.amazonaws.com endpoint — Amazon S3 automatically routes requests to facilities in Northern Virginia or the Pacific Northwest using network maps.

  • s3-external-1.amazonaws.com endpoint — Amazon S3 routes requests to a facility in Northern Virginia. This is especially useful in a scenario where you require low-latency access to your Amazon S3 data from Amazon EC2 in the Northern Virginia Region.

Important

If you use a region other than the US Standard endpoint to create a bucket, you must set the LocationConstraint bucket parameter to the same region. Both the AWS SDK for Java and AWS SDK for .NET use an enumeration for setting location constraints (Region for Java, S3Region for .NET). For more information, go to Buckets and Regions in the Amazon Simple Storage Service Developer Guide.

Amazon Simple Storage Service Website Endpoints

When you configure your bucket as a website, the website is available using the following region-specific website endpoints. Note that the website endpoints are different than the REST API endpoints listed in the preceding table. For more information about hosting websites on Amazon S3, go to Hosting Websites on Amazon S3 in the Amazon Simple Storage Service Developer Guide. You need the hosted zone IDs when using the Amazon Route 53 API to add an alias record to your hosted zone.

Region Website endpoint Hosted zone ID
US Standard s3-website-us-east-1.amazonaws.com Z3AQBSTGFYJSTF 
US West (Oregon) Region

s3-website-us-west-2.amazonaws.com

 Z3BJ6K6RIION7M
US West (Northern California) Region

s3-website-us-west-1.amazonaws.com

 Z2F56UZL2M1ACD 
EU (Ireland) Region

s3-website-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com

 Z1BKCTXD74EZPE
Asia Pacific (Singapore) Region

s3-website-ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com

 Z3O0J2DXBE1FTB
Asia Pacific (Sydney) Region

s3-website-ap-southeast-2.amazonaws.com

 Z1WCIGYICN2BYD
Asia Pacific (Tokyo) Region

s3-website-ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com

 Z2M4EHUR26P7ZW
South America (Sao Paulo) Region

s3-website-sa-east-1.amazonaws.com

 Z7KQH4QJS55SO
AWS GovCloud (US)

s3-website-us-gov-west-1.amazonaws.com

 Z31GFT0UA1I2HV

AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)

IAM has a single endpoint: https://iam.amazonaws.com.

For information about using AWS Identity and Access Management in AWS GovCloud (US), go to AWS GovCloud (US) Endpoints.

AWS Import/Export

AWS Import/Export has a single endpoint: importexport.amazonaws.com and only supports HTTPS requests.

AWS OpsWorks

AWS OpsWorks has a single endpoint: opsworks.us-east-1.amazonaws.com (HTTPS).

AWS Security Token Service

Currently, the AWS Security Token Service has a single endpoint: https://sts.amazonaws.com.

For information about using AWS Security Token Service in AWS GovCloud (US), go to AWS GovCloud (US) Endpoints.

South America (Sao Paulo) Region sa-east-1 storagegateway.sa-east-1.amazonaws.com HTTPS

AWS Support

AWS Support has a single endpoint: support.us-east-1.amazonaws.com (HTTPS).

Elastic Load Balancing

To create or work with a load balancer in a specific region, use the corresponding regional service endpoint. Elastic Load Balancing supports the endpoints listed in the following table.

Region Name Region Endpoint Protocol
US East (Northern Virginia) Region us-east-1 elasticloadbalancing.us-east-1.amazonaws.com HTTP and HTTPS
US West (Oregon) Region us-west-2 elasticloadbalancing.us-west-2.amazonaws.com HTTP and HTTPS
US West (Northern California) Region us-west-1 elasticloadbalancing.us-west-1.amazonaws.com HTTP and HTTPS
EU (Ireland) Region eu-west-1 elasticloadbalancing.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com HTTP and HTTPS
Asia Pacific (Singapore) Region ap-southeast-1 elasticloadbalancing.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com HTTP and HTTPS
Asia Pacific (Sydney) Region ap-southeast-2 elasticloadbalancing.ap-southeast-2.amazonaws.com HTTP and HTTPS
Asia Pacific (Tokyo) Region ap-northeast-1 elasticloadbalancing.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com HTTP and HTTPS
South America (Sao Paulo) Region sa-east-1 elasticloadbalancing.sa-east-1.amazonaws.com HTTP and HTTPS

If you just specify the general endpoint (elasticloadbalancing.amazonaws.com), Elastic Load Balancing directs your request to the us-east-1 endpoint.

For information about using Elastic Load Balancing in AWS GovCloud (US), go to AWS GovCloud (US) Endpoints.

AWS GovCloud (US) Region

For information about endpoints and protocols in the AWS GovCloud (US) Region, go to AWS GovCloud (US) Endpoints in the AWS GovCloud (US) User Guide.
